dt: {bc}a concluding section that rounds out the design of a literary work
{bc}a speech often in verse addressed to the audience by an actor at the end of a play
{bc}the final scene of a play that comments on or summarizes the main action
{bc}the concluding section of a musical composition {bc}{sx|coda||}

et: Middle English {it}epiloge{/it}, from Middle French {it}epilogue{/it}, from Latin {it}epilogus{/it}, from Greek {it}epilogos{/it}, from {it}epilegein{/it} to say in addition, from {it}epi-{/it} + {it}legein{/it} to say {ma}{mat|legend|}{/ma}
shortdef: a concluding section that rounds out the design of a literary work
a speech often in verse addressed to the audience by an actor at the end of a play; also : the actor speaking such an epilogue
the final scene of a play that comments on or summarizes the main action
